GapFillInput.Title: Polite requests
GapFillInput.Instruction: Read each situation. Then complete the request making any necessary changes.

Content.Question:
1. You want Elena to turn down her music.
Elena, would you mind turning down your music|turning down the music, please? I’m trying
to work.
2. You would like to read John’s magazine.
Is it okay if I read your magazine|if I borrow your magazine|if I look at your magazine, John?
3. You want Ros to fetch your glasses.
Ros, could you fetch my glasses|you get my glasses|you bring my glasses, please?
4. You want to phone Mike tomorrow because you’re busy.
Do you mind if I phone you tomorrow|if I call you tomorrow|if I ring you tomorrow, Mike?
I’m very busy right now.
5. You want to know if it’s possible for Hiro to translate something for you.
Hiro, could you possibly translate|you translate this for me?
6. You want the shop assistant to make you ten photocopies.
Will you make me ten copies, please?
7. You want a stranger to take a photo of yourself and your friend.
Excuse me. Do you think you could take a photo of us, please?
8. You want the bank clerk to change £50 into ten £5 notes.
Would you change|you mind changing this for ten £5 notes, please?
9. Your computer is frozen and you’d like Ann to have a look at it.
Ann, my computer’s frozen. Do you mind having a look at|checking|looking at it, please?
10. You want to go home early because you aren’t feeling well.
Do you think I could go home early? I’m not feeling well.
